intro: Unisema heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaved unisema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a pale yellow to pinkish color. Unisema heterophylla is often found in coastal or arid regions, showing adaptability to harsh climates.
